basic.description: This course covers acceleration in rotating curvilinear coordinates; momentum, continuity, and energy equations; geostrophic, gradient, and thermal winds; generalized coordinates; circulation and vorticity theorems; scale analysis; Reynolds stresses; Prandtl and Ekman layers; developing baroclinic systems.
basic.subject: MET
basic.title: Atmospheric Dynamics I

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: MET 3300 with a grade of "C" or better. Corequisites: MAP 2302 or MAP 3305; and MET 4420.
